children.name: open
Example - subscribe to the "open" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "open" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the popup opens

children.name: deactivate
Example - subscribe to the "deactivate" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "deactivate" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the popup is closed

children.name: close
Example - subscribe to the "close" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "close" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the popup closes

children.name: activate
Example - subscribe to the "activate" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "activate" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the popup is opened

children.name: visible
children.description: Checks whether the popup is visible

children.name: setOptions
children.description: Changes the initial Popup configuration.

children.name: position
children.description: Re-positions the popup element

children.name: open
children.description: Opens the popup.

children.name: close
children.description: Closes the popup.

children.name: position
Example - position the popup on top of the anchor

children.description: Specifies which point of the popup element to attach to the anchor's origin point. The value isspace separated "y" plus "x" position.The available "y" positions are:- "bottom"- "center"- "top"The available "x" positions are:- "left"- "center"- "right"

children.name: origin
Example - position the popup on top of the anchor

children.description: Specifies how to position the popup element based on achor point. The value isspace separated "y" plus "x" position.The available "y" positions are:- "bottom"- "center"- "top"The available "x" positions are:- "left"- "center"- "right"

children.name: appendTo
children.description: Which element the popup will be appended to.

children.name: anchor
children.description: Specifies the element that will be used as an anchor. The widget will open next to that element.

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description: The duration of the open animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.open.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the open animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.open
children.description: The animation played when the calendar popup is opened.

children.name: animation.close.duration
children.description: The duration of the close animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.close.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the close animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.close
children.description: The animation played when the popup is closed.

children.name: animation
Example - disable open and close animations

children.description: Configures the opening and closing animations of the popup. Setting the `animation` option to `false` will disable the opening and closing animations. As a result the popup will open and close instantly.
